articles.author: Bill  Whitaker, Sarah  Koch
articles.title: Human "biology was never intended to handle" ultraprocessed foods, former FDA head David Kessler warns - CBS News
articles.description: There are Americans who are "obscenely obese and at the same time malnourished," Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. says. He blames ultraprocessed food.
articles.content: Today, an increasing number of Americans across the political spectrum – from Make America Healthy Again activists to everyday shoppers – are voicing concern about the health impact of ultraprocessed… [+11868 chars]

articles.title: What is the dart frog toxin allegedly used to kill Alexei Navalny? - BBC
articles.description: The toxin, epibatidine, can be found in frogs in the wild in South America or manufactured in a lab.
articles.content: Because it overstimulates these nerve receptors, if dosed correctly, it can cause muscle twitching, paralysis, seizures, slow heart rate, respiratory failure and ultimately death, she explained.

articles.title: Trump claims victory on affordability as public anxieties persist - The Washington Post
articles.description: Advisers had been encouraging the president to sound more empathetic toward struggling Americans. But as some bright spots emerge, the messaging has shifted.
articles.content:
The White House is declaring victory on turning around the economy, after months of aides urging the president to find a more empathetic tone on Americans financial struggles.
